answers.text:
Hi Mark, 
Thank you for the interesting question about sister cities! While we have little information on African sister cities specifically there are many genera lsister city documents, articles, and questions on the Knowledge Network that can give you a great place to start in your sister county efforts. 
•   Here is a recent question on sister cities that contains stories, documents, and contact information from different local governments with successful sister city programs. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/22521
•   Sister Cities Advisory Board Rules and Regulations is a great document that discusses how one community has set up their sister city relationship and how it works. icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/10587
•   This CityLinks Application is specifically for  Africa, Asia, and the Middle East. This is a matching program through ICMA and a few other partnering organizations and it may provide you with what you are looking for. Included in the application is additional contact information if you have any further questions about the program. icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/10587
I hope you find these documents useful! 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: James Verbrugge
answers.text:
Mark, the City of Brooklyn Park MN established a sister city relationship with Kakata (in Margibi County), Liberia in July 2012.  The relationship was initiated through the efforts of a committee of Liberian community members in and around Brooklyn Park.  Our area has one of the largest concentrations of Liberians outside the Republic of Liberia.  The local committee acts as the intermediary for communications and coordination of activities.  The recognition of the relationship is more than city-to-city as it works to leverage relationships with higher ed institutions and other resources in the community.  Please let me know if there is more information that would be beneficial for what you are researching.
Thank you.
Jamie Verbrugge
City Manager

answers.author: Cory Fleming
answers.text:
Mark, 
A friend who is based in South Africa right now suggests contacting the nonprofit organization, Sister Cities International.  From his response... 
"Mary Kane, CEO of Sister Cities International (based in DC), visited SA last year as part of a successful sister cities program between Milwaukee and Richard’s Bay.  I know they’re eager to see more sister city relationships between American and South African cities  http://www.sister-cities.org/ ." 
Cory Fleming

answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
Charlottesville, Virginia has been a sister city of Winneba, Ghana since August 2010. The details are at http://www.charlottesville.org/Index.aspx?page=2985 
A Ghanaian resident of Charlottesville first proposed the idea, and City Council made an MOU with support from Sister Cities International. Last year a delegation from Winneba visited our city as part of our 250th historical events.

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text: Do any counties have sister/partner relationships with counties in Africa?  If so how did you go about setting it up?  Thanks.
title: Sister County / City in Africa?
